{ "slug": "remote-medical-record-specialist-accompany-health-1093756", "id": "1093756", "epoch": 1754064009, "date": "2025-08-01T16:00:09+00:00", "company": "Accompany Health", "company_logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/d346a8bc9747533a4cb3f466d3c2dff51754064009.png", "position": "Medical Record Specialist", "tags": [ "education", "lead", "go", "medical", "health", "healthcare", "full-time", "non tech" ], "logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/d346a8bc9747533a4cb3f466d3c2dff51754064009.png", "description": "

Accompany Health is on a mission to give low-income patients with complex needs the dignified, high-quality care they deserve but rarely receive. A primary, behavioral, and social care provider, Accompany Health walks alongside patients for their entire care journey, offering at-home and virtual care, as well as 24/7 support. Partnering with innovative payors, Accompany Health is powered by remarkable care teams, elegant technology, and a commitment to evidence-based practice. 


We build long-term relationships with our patients so they know, without question, that our team is here for them day or night, year after year. We focus on the health outcomes most important to our patients to make it clear that they lead the way.


To achieve our mission, we collaborate with community-based organizations, local providers, and health plans. Led by our empathetic care teams, guided by proven care models, and powered by our own technology, we deliver a level of service that our communities rightfully deserve but rarely receive. 


While our headquarters is in Bethesda, MD, our teams are distributed across the country.  If you\u00e2\u0080\u0099re eager to make a tangible difference in people\u00e2\u0080\u0099s lives, to help correct long-standing disparities in health care, join us. 


About the role:


As a Value Based Care (VBC) Medical Record Specialist for Accompany Health (AH) you will be:

-Performing external medical record note review to populate pertinent historical information in the patient\u00e2\u0080\u0099s Accompany Health (AH) athenahealth record.

-Sending external Medical Record Requests and obtaining then categorizing the records when they return.

-HEDIS measure prep to alert the provider of current results and open gaps that need to be addressed.


\\n


Responsibilities will include:
  • Review collected medical records housed in a repository, through the athenahealth  Electronic Medical Record (EMR) or via EMR access to outside facility records, for pre-visit chart prep.
  • While reviewing the above medical records, identify key evidence for quality gap closure and transfer that data to designated locations within the patient\u00e2\u0080\u0099s AH athenahealth medical record.
  • Identify and transfer pertinent lab results to populate the AH athenahealth medical record.
  • Summarize identified trends with each patient (i.e., high ED use, frequent hospitalizations), and communicate findings to the clinician via EMR notes.
  • Categorize key documents into appropriate chart note sections for clinician  ease of review. 
  • Successful closure of medical record requests, using follow up to facilities to obtain the requested records. 
  • Accurately identify documents and categorize them appropriately in the AH EMR. 
  • Using the AH proprietary platform to identify HEDIS measure gaps and closures and complete the designated Quality and Preventive Services template in the EMR to assist the provider in determining open gaps.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • This role reports to the Lead Medical Record Specialist.


What makes you a fit for the team:
  • You are excited to work in a startup environment, with the ambiguity and shifting priorities that might come with it at times.
  • You are willing to go the extra mile no matter what.
  • You are passionate about our mission to improve the lives and healthcare outcomes of marginalized communities.


Desired skills and experience:
  • Required
  • Associates degree, Medical Record Certification (i.e. AHIMA), or equivalent
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in healthcare industry with health information and/or direct medical record review and oversight
  • Comfort with multiple technology platforms, including but not limited to a variety of EMRs
  • Attention to detail 

  • Preferred 
  • Experience in pre-visit planning 
  • Experience with athenahealth
  • Experience with GSuite and Google applications


\\n
$20 - $20 an hour
The base salary range for this full-time position is $20/hour + equity + benefits.  Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location.  The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position.  Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.  Our talent team can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
\\n

#LI-Remote

#LI-LB1


For Patient Facing Roles

To keep our patients, communities and each other safe, you'll be required to comply with Accompany Health\u00e2\u0080\u0099s medical clearance requirements, including completing a TB screen and providing proof of immunity or vaccination for certain conditions. This is a condition of employment, and we make exceptions as required by law. Accommodation for religious and medical beliefs will be provided on a case by case basis.


We embrace diversity and believe it creates a healthier atmosphere:  Accompany Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

{ "slug": "remote-blockchain-security-expert-ai-track-certik-1093753", "id": "1093753", "epoch": 1754038802, "date": "2025-08-01T09:00:02+00:00", "company": "CertiK", "company_logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/c79a80402ac6750c348040c44d3d0bd41754038802.png", "position": "Blockchain Security Expert AI Track", "tags": [ "security", "web3", "support", "software", "sales", "engineering", "full-time" ], "logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/c79a80402ac6750c348040c44d3d0bd41754038802.png", "description": "

About the Company

One of the fastest-growing and most trusted companies in blockchain security, CertiK is a true market leader. To date, CertiK has worked with over 4,798 clients, secured over $597 billion worth of digital assets, and has monitored over 17,000 projects. Our clients include leading projects such as Aave, Polygon, Yearn, and Chiliz.


Investors = Insight Partners, Sequoia, Tiger Global, Coatue Management, Lightspeed, Advent International, SoftBank, Hillhouse Capital, Goldman Sachs, Shunwei Capital, IDG Capital, Wing, Legend Star, Danhua Capital and other investors.


About the Role

The primary focus of this role is to pioneer the development of an intelligent AI agent powered by large language models (LLMs) to enhance our security audit tools in the blockchain space. As a Blockchain Security Expert on the AI Track, you will work closely with our blockchain security team to bridge cutting-edge academic research with practical applications. Your efforts will be dedicated to developing, testing, and optimizing LLM-driven AI agents that automatically analyze smart contracts and identify potential vulnerabilities. In this role, you'll be immersed in research and experimentation, exploring new methods to improve threat detection and risk assessment within our security audit platform, thereby directly contributing to more secure blockchain infrastructures.

\\n


Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with our blockchain security team to develop an LLM-based AI agent for security audit tools.
  • Experiment with novel AI techniques to enhance threat detection and risk assessment in blockchain environments.
  • Assist in transforming cutting-edge research on AI agents into practical, scalable security auditing solutions.
  • Continuously research emerging trends in LLMs, AI agent architectures, and cybersecurity, and proactively propose improvements.


Requirements
  • A bachelor\u00e2\u0080\u0099s degree (or higher), preferably in a science or engineering field.
  • 2+ years of security or software development experience.
  • Familiar with blockchain and smart contract technologies.
  • Familiar with agentic coding tools, such as Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, etc.
  • Strong and creative problem-solving skills; always willing to learn and embrace new technologies, and to collaborate.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Prior research or project experience in developing AI agents or automated security analysis tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to translate research insights into effective, production-ready tools.
  • Prior knowledge of web3 security audits.
  • Hands-on blockchain experience, such as evaluating risks for blockchain projects or analyzing on-chain security events.


\\n

Compensation: If the role is performed in the US, the target annual compensation is $120,000 - $180,000. The exact compensation at which this job is filled will be determined by the skills and experience of qualified candidates.


#blockchain

#startups

#hiring


CertiK accepts applications for this position on an ongoing basis.


CertiK is proud to offer medical, vision, and dental insurance, 401(k) plan with company matching, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, HSA (with high deductible plan), FSA, and other benefits to all full-time employees, along with flexible paid time off and holidays. CertiK also offers a variable commission program for business development sales roles.


In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.


CertiK is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law.


CertiK will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.

https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf


All CertiK employees are expected to actively support diversity on their teams, and in the Company.

{ "slug": "remote-growth-marketing-lead-anchorage-digital-1093752", "id": "1093752", "epoch": 1754035205, "date": "2025-08-01T08:00:05+00:00", "company": "Anchorage Digital", "company_logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/f31c092d0b5228749cbb164bf38338d21754035206.png", "position": "Growth Marketing Lead", "tags": [ "growth", "crypto", "security", "testing", "financial", "finance", "bank", "leader", "management", "lead", "marketing", "analytics", "legal", "engineering" ], "logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/f31c092d0b5228749cbb164bf38338d21754035206.png", "description": "

At Anchorage Digital, we are building the world\u00e2\u0080\u0099s most advanced digital asset platform for institutions to participate in crypto.


Anchorage Digital is a crypto platform that enables institutions to participate in digital assets through custody, staking, trading, governance, settlement, and the industry's leading security infrastructure. Home to Anchorage Digital Bank N.A., the only federally chartered crypto bank in the U.S., Anchorage Digital also serves institutions through Anchorage Digital Singapore, Porto by Anchorage Digital, and other offerings.


The company is funded by leading institutions including Andreessen Horowitz, GIC, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and Visa, with its Series D valuation over $3 billion. Founded in 2017 in San Francisco, California, Anchorage Digital has offices in New York, New York; Porto, Portugal; Singapore; and Sioux Falls, South Dakota. Learn more at anchorage.com, on X @Anchorage, and on LinkedIn. 


Are you a seasoned B2B growth marketing leader with a proven track record of driving significant growth in fast-moving, regulated industry? Do you thrive on both strategic planning and hands-on execution? We're looking for a dynamic and innovative Growth Marketing Lead to own our growth marketing function, build and mentor a high-performing team, and propel our company to new heights. If you're excited by the challenge of shaping the future of crypto infrastructure, we want to hear from you!


We have created the Factors of Growth & Impact to help Villagers better measure impact and articulate coaching, feedback, and the rich and rewarding learning that happens while exploring, developing, and mastering the capabilities and contributions within and outside of the Growth Marketing Lead role:

\\n


Technical Skills:
  • Drive: Proactively identifies, tests and scales new growth opportunities, leveraging emerging marketing technologies and best practices.
  • Build: Develops and implements robust marketing automation, analytics, and attribution models to measure and optimize campaign performance.


Complexity and Impact of Work:
  • Lead: Leads the development and execution of the overall growth marketing strategy, aligning with business objectives and revenue targets.
  • Manage: Manages complex marketing funnels, A/B testing frameworks, and experimentation roadmaps to continuously improve conversion rates.


Organizational Knowledge:
  • Collaborate: Works cross-functionally with sales, product, and engineering teams to ensure seamless customer journeys and integrated marketing efforts.
  • Deliver: Consistently delivers on key performance indicators (KPIs) and contributes directly to the company's revenue growth.


Communication and Influence:
  • Listen: Actively listens to market feedback, customer insights, and team input to refine marketing strategies.
  • Contribute: Contributes thought leadership and insights to the broader organization on market trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.


You may be a fit for this role if you have:
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in B2B marketing, with a focus on growth  or demand generation
  • Demonstrated ability to drive significant customer acquisition and revenue growth in a B2B crypto, fintech, or other complex/regulated industries.
  • Strong leadership experience, including direct management of marketing teams.
  • Expertise in account-based marketing (ABM) strategies and tools, SEO, SEM, marketing automation platforms, CRM systems, and analytics tools (e.g., Salesforce, Google Analytics, Tableau).
  • A strategic mindset coupled with a hands-on approach to problem-solving and campaign execution.


Although not a requirement, bonus points if:
  • You were emotionally moved by the soundtrack to Hamilton, which chronicles the founding of a new financial system. :)


\\n

About Anchorage Digital: Who we are


The Anchorage Village, what we call our team, brings together the brightest minds from platform security, financial services, and distributed ledger technology to provide the building blocks that empower institutions to safely participate in  the evolving digital asset ecosystem. As a diverse team of more than 300 members, we are united in one common goal: building the future of finance by providing the foundation upon which value moves safely in the new global economy. 


Anchorage Digital is committed to being a welcoming and inclusive workplace for everyone, and we are intentional about making sure people feel respected, supported, and connected at work\u00e2\u0080\u0094regardless of who you are or where you come from. We value and celebrate our differences and we believe being open about who we are allows us to do the best work of our lives.

 

Anchorage Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. Anchorage Digital considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with other legal requirements. \u00e2\u0080\u009cAnchorage Digital\u00e2\u0080\u009d refers to services that are offered either through Anchorage Digital Bank National Association, an OCC-chartered national trust bank, or Anchorage Lending CA, LLC a finance lender licensed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, License No. 60DBO-11976, or Anchorage Digital Singapore Pte Ltd, a Singapore private limited company, all wholly-owned subsidiaries of Anchor Labs, Inc., a Delaware corporation.


Protecting your privacy rights is important to Anchorage Digital, and we work to maintain the trust and confidence of our clients when handling personal or financial information. Please see our privacy policy notices here.

{ "slug": "remote-data-engineer-nomi-health-1093750", "id": "1093750", "epoch": 1753920010, "date": "2025-07-31T00:00:10+00:00", "company": "Nomi Health", "company_logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/a63705b4f82e895a31f800361fb5d6b31753920013.png", "position": "Data Engineer", "tags": [ "technical", "testing", "nosql", "medical", "engineer", "engineering" ], "logo": "https://remoteok.com/assets/img/jobs/a63705b4f82e895a31f800361fb5d6b31753920013.png", "description": "

We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team in Austin, Texas. You will be responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance of our data pipelines to integrate with our platform ensuring data is accessible, clean, and optimized.

\\n


How you will make an impact
  • Design, implement, and maintain efficient data pipelines (ETLs) in order to integrate data from a variety of sources into Nomi\u00e2\u0080\u0099s platform 
  • Support automated processes for complex data analysis, management, and visualizations that incorporate data governance 
  • Make decisions on complex data issues regarding technical approach for project components and reporting requirements 
  • Design and implement data model changes that align with Nomi\u00e2\u0080\u0099s standards 
  • Develop and execute testing strategies to ensure high quality data 
  • Work with different teams within Nomi to reach end goals 


What we are looking for
  • 2+ years in data engineering or related field 
  • Skilled with NoSQL and SQL (Snowflake) 
  • AWS (preferred but not required) resources such as lambdas, docDB, EC2 
  • Data first approach 
  • Experience with Python, Git, and Jira 
  • Experience with sensitive data is a bonus 


\\n
